pageContext.description: Butt damaged and cracked. Crack terminates in a small hole. Cast marks down sides. Flanges beaten inwards forming small wings near stop ridge.
pageContext.surface: Smooth. Worn in parts. Golden bronze shows at edges.
pageContext.publications: Proc. Soc. Ant. 1864 (Vol II, 2nd ser. pp. 249-251)
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,33(2),Presented by Earol of Powis
pageContext.site: Wales,Montgomeryshire (Powys),Welshpool,between Crother's Camp or Coppice and Pool Quay.,In a field called "The Camp","Guilsfield Hoard"
pageContext.toSearch: Coppice Lane, Welshpool, Powys Sy21, UK
pageContext.remarks: This and No. 33(1) were not included in specimens exhibited to S of A by Saml. Wood Esq. FSA. at that time.
